heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 06 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 51.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.5°C) and outside temperature (up 1.7°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%) and rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 906 m) and light levels (up 9636 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm), cloud levels (up 1036 m), and light levels (up 8461 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 905.8m lower than yesterday, 214.9m lower than the past week, 1035.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 737m minimum and 4780m maximum, with an average of 1487.9m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1702.8m and 2520m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, very sticky and muggy conditions are expected and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Changeable conditions.
